newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugoslavia cuts import duties on new cars - papers.
newsitem.headline: Yugoslavia cuts import duties on new cars - papers.

text.p: The Yugoslav government has reduced special taxes and duties on imports of new passenger cars and smaller commercial vehicles, Belgrade newspapers reported on Friday.

"The measure, effective from May 26, will apply to cars with engines between 1500 and 3000 cc and cargo vehicles up to a 5.5-tonnes capacity," Yugoslav Foreign Trade Minister Borisa Vukovic was quoted by Nasa Borba as saying.
Under the decision, special customs taxes and duties on those categories of vehicles will be reduced to 53.75 percent from the previous 77 percent.
Duties for smaller cars and bigger trucks remain unchanged.
The measure will be valid until the adoption of a new law on customs tariffs probably in early July, Vukovic said.
According to the government, the move is aimed at satisfying the needs of buyers of cars and commercial vehicles that are not manufactured in the country and does not threaten domestic producers.
The country's car manufacturer Zastava of Kragujevac produces only smaller passenger cars, but Zastava Trucks' production programme does include smaller trucks.
The decision does not apply to second hand cars. -- Amra Kevic, Belgrade newsroom +381 11 222 4305
